Generation V.Black: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
Generation V.White: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
Generation V.Black 2: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.
Generation V.White 2: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.

Generation VI.X: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
Generation VI.Y: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.
Generation VIII.Shield: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
Generation IX.Violet: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.

Generation VIII.Sword: Axew's Eye , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye Sw ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Axew's Eye , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye Sw ( Max Raid Battle )
